channel.title: Home Barista
channel.description: The house of Home Barista - Provides news, brewing guides, and stories about coffee.

item.title: What Is Cortado?
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description:
There are so many opinions on what Cortado is. Whether you are ordering a Cortado or offering it to your customers, there is much room for discussion. Nevertheless, it is still the main item on the coffee menu, but due to various factors, it may not exist for long.

What Is Cortado? Read More >>

item.title: Brew Coffee At Home: 11 Brewing Methods Compared
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Are you looking for a new appliance to make coffee? There are many utensils to choose from, and the coffee brewed by each utensil also tastes different. Let's not mention the difficulty of operation here.

Brew Coffee At Home: 11 Brewing Methods Compared Read More >>

item.title: Train Your Coffee Palate
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
For baristas, you have to go through the cupping test to get the beans you want. For consumers, it is not necessary to know cupping. As long as you know how to measure, you will feel different when you drink coffee.

Train Your Coffee Palate Read More >>

item.title: Turkish Coffee: Not only Coffee But Life
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
In fact, Turkish coffee has been around for a long time. Let's introduce Turkish coffee well!

Turkish Coffee: Not only Coffee But Life Read More >>

item.title: What Is Decaffeinated Coffee?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
For some sensitive people, just a little bit of caffeine is enough to have a negative effect. This is where decaffeinated coffee is a good choice for such sensitive people or for those who have deliberately given up caffeine.

What Is Decaffeinated Coffee? Read More >>

item.title: Trading Patterns Of Green Coffee Beans
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
What is the trading model for green coffee beans? Whether you are a producer, a roaster, or a consumer, you can make a more informed choice if you know more about how it is bought and sold.

Trading Patterns Of Green Coffee Beans Read More >>

item.title: How To Use A French Press?
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
If you already have a beloved French press in your cupboard, get it out, wash it and follow these simple steps to make a brand new cup of coffee!

How To Use A French Press? Read More >>

item.title: Understand The Three Stages Of The Espresso Extraction
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
The extraction process of the espresso is not simple, even if the extraction time is very short. There are many chemical and physical changes taking place in the coffee ground when you extract it.

Understand The Three Stages Of The Espresso Extraction Read More >>

item.title: Physical Changes During Coffee Roasting
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Roasting can transform coffee beans from green beans into mature beans with rich aroma and flavor, but do you know what happens in the roasting process? It is mainly divided into physical and chemical changes. Let's first look at the physical changes of coffee beans during roasting.

Physical Changes During Coffee Roasting Read More >>

item.title: Why Does Coffee Need Degassing? It's Better To Drink After Degassing
item.dc:creator: Erick
item.description:
Many beginners of coffee have heard that degassing needs to be stored in one-way exhaust valve bags or one-way exhaust valve cans. Indeed, these steps will make the flavor of coffee beans better.

Why Does Coffee Need Degassing? It's Better To Drink After Degassing Read More >>
